abstract.text: This pages showcases results of my master thesis - A modular framework for building AR Applications on Apple XR Devices interacting with ROS-based Robots

inlineContent.text: This demonstrates the exchange of ROS2 Interfaces between the virtual entities, that can be in use cases like virtual tiggers or emergency stops. This further demonstrates the publisher, subscription concepts of ROS.

Apple’s visionOS natively supports USD and also uses reality(Apple’s 3D Model representation format) but there is no native solution that can convert URDFs to reality or USD. There is a tool from NVIDIA that does convert URDF to USD but it not yet tested on Apple Platforms like macOS or visionOS. As a part of the thesis, a macOS application was developed that can convert ROS2 robot description packages to reality was created. The robot model is localized to it’s real pose with the help of fiducial markers.

Using the intuitive hand gestures APIs offered by visionOS, the Manipulator is commanded to move to the virtual control sphere’s pose. This futher demonstrates the service client and action client concepts of ROS.
In order to demonstrate the visualization capabilities on visionOS, PointCloud2 is render in realtime that is published from the Realsense D455 Camera to the network.
